intro: Tylophora erecta, commonly known as the Chinese trumpet vine, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, tubular flowers that are typically white or yellow in color. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and has traditional uses in herbal medicine. Tylophora erecta thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, preferring well-drained soil and partial to full sunlight.
